Identification.LongTitle: An Act respecting Small Business Investment Grants

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Investment Grants Act.

Definition.Text: Minister means such member of the Queen’s Privy Council for Canada as is designated by the Governor in Council as the Minister for the purposes of this Act;
prescribed means prescribed by the regulations.

Subsection.Text: On application to the Minister by a person who establishes in the form and manner prescribed that he is, pursuant to the regulations, eligible to receive a grant in respect of interest payable by the person on a prescribed small business investment debt obligation owed by him, the Minister may, subject to the regulations, make a grant to the person or his agent of such amount, not exceeding four per cent per annum of the principle balance outstanding from time to time of the debt obligation, as would reduce the effective rate of interest on the debt obligation for the period in respect of which the grant is made to not less than twelve per cent per annum.
Where a person who is eligible to receive a grant under subsection (1) authorizes the Minister to make the grant to an agent of the person,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister may make the grant to that agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the authorization in respect of which the grant is made may not be amended or revoked without the consent of the Minister.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may only make grants under subsection (1) in respect of small business investment debt obligations that are incurred prior to April 1, 1983.

Section.Text: The Governor in Council may make regulations prescribing anything that by this Act is to be prescribed and providing for all other matters and things as he deems necessary to carry out the provisions of this Act.

Subsection.Text: Where a grant is made to a person under section 3 and for any reason

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is not entitled to the grant,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the grant exceeds the amount to which the person is entitled, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a term or condition to which the grant is subject has not been met or has been contravened,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the amount of the grant or excess, as the case may be, together with interest determined as prescribed and computed from the date the grant is made, is a debt due to Her Majesty in right of Canada and may be recovered as such from the person in any court of competent jurisdiction.

Subsection.Text: Where a circumstance referred to in paragraph (1)(a), (b) or (c) occurs in respect of a grant made to a person under section 3 and the Minister has, under such conditions as are prescribed, advised the person in writing that the amount of the grant will not be recovered from the person in that circumstance, subsection (1) shall, effective on the date the circumstance occurred, cease to apply in respect of the grant.

Everyone who, under this Act, submits any information or documentation, makes any statement or answers any question, whether in connection with an application for a grant or otherwise, knowing that the information, documentation, statement or answer is false or misleading or misrepresents or fails to disclose a material fact, is guilty of an offence and is liable

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on summary conviction, to a fine not exceeding ten thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or to both; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding one hundred thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years or to both.

Section.Text: This Act shall come into force on a day to be fixed by proclamation.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Act in force May 19, 1983, see SI/83-112.]
